Package aips.search

Class Path

java.lang.Object
java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
java.util.AbstractList<E>
java.util.AbstractSequentialList<E>
java.util.LinkedList<ActionStatePair>
aips.search.Path
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<ActionStatePair>, java.util.Collection<ActionStatePair>, java.util.Deque<ActionStatePair>, java.util.List<ActionStatePair>, java.util.Queue<ActionStatePair>
public class Path
extends java.util.LinkedList<ActionStatePair>
This class models a path that traces the route from a root node to a node in the tree. It is simply a list of ActionStatePair objects plus a head node (of State). Conceptually a path is a specialised list of action-state pairs with a head node. That is why it is extending the LinkedList concrete class which implements the List interface. I chose the LinkedList class in this case. It can be any class that implements List. You do not need to do with this class. A Path is returned as the result when you do a search. If the returned value is not null, you can simply call the print() method to print out the path.
Author:
K. Hui

  • Method Details

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints the path, with each node and action. The output is controlled by the toString() method of the State objects and Action objects, which can be customised in the domain specific sub-classes.
